senses.sense_definition: A ship designed to carry oil in bulk.

examples.text: The navy deployed a fleet replenishment <w>oiler</w> to refuel the destroyers at sea.
A massive <w>oiler</w> was spotted near the harbor transporting crude oil.

senses.sense_definition: A small metal container with a spout used for dispensing oil onto machinery.

examples.text: The mechanic grabbed a pump <w>oiler</w> to grease the squeaky hinges.
Please pass me the <w>oiler</w> so I can lubricate the bicycle chain.

senses.sense_definition: A worker in a ship's engine room responsible for lubricating machinery.

examples.text: He started his career at sea working as an <w>oiler</w> on a merchant vessel.
The engine room <w>oiler</w> checked the fluid levels on the main generators.

senses.sense_definition: An automatic device attached to a machine to supply it with oil.

examples.text: An automatic <w>oiler</w> keeps the gears running smoothly without manual intervention.
The maintenance crew replaced the broken drip <w>oiler</w> on the lathe.
The company struck a productive <w>oiler</w> in the middle of the desert.
Investors were excited about the potential of the new <w>oiler</w>.

senses.sense_definition: A person who flatters others excessively to gain favor.

examples.text: Nobody respects a social <w>oiler</w> who only compliments the boss for a promotion.
She dismissed him as an <w>oiler</w> trying to climb the social ladder.
